channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump is 'shredding' credibility with allies while China benefits, former national security advisor John Bolton says
item.description: "We're having a war with our friends and really crippling our ability to deal effectively with China," Bolton told CNBC.

item.title: U.S. stocks look to build on back-to-back gains â€” live updates
Economic calendar: Data due on import prices and N.Y. regional manufacturing
Trump administration says it lacks authority to get Abrego Garcia back from El Salvador
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to provide daily updates on efforts to recover Kilmar Abrego Garcia from an El Salvador prison.

item.title: Fund managers have never turned this pessimistic so quickly on U.S. stocks
Singapore announces general election on May 3, dissolves parliament
item.description: This will be Singapore's 14th general election since independence, and will be Wong's first general election as prime minister.

item.title: Tax Day: Not ready to file your 2024 income-tax return? Here are your options.
Harvard has $2.2 billion in grants frozen by Trump administration after rejecting demands
item.description: The Trump administration has zeroed in on colleges in a crackdown on diversity, equity and inclusion programs in the United States.

item.title: Another Wall Street firm has lowered its S&P 500 target, citing stagflation risk
U.S. businesses sue to block Trump tariffs, say trade deficits are not an emergency
item.description: The Trump administration's argument is undercut by its imposing tariffs on countries the U.S. does not have a trade deficit with, the plaintiffs say.
